timeline.body: Looks as if your editor forgot to replace `${year}` with the actual year!
timeline.bodyText: Looks as if your editor forgot to replace ${year} with the actual year!
timeline.bodyHTML: Looks as if your editor forgot to replace ${year} with the actual year!
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: I replaced it with 2020 in the latest commit.
replies.author: reeshabhranjan

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think you can also just do:

Set<Var> vars = new HashSet<>(pattern.getVarList());

I don't think the rest of the method requires that vars is an ArrayList (or even a list), so no need to create an arraylist back out of the set. Saves having to copy the elements over twice.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Alright! I will make this change and update this pull request.
replies.author: reeshabhranjan

timeline.message:
#1873 a set is iterable, so passed the set directly to `countConstantVars()` method, as suggested by @jeenbroekstra; added the actual year in the header comment in CardinalityTest.java

Signed-off-by: Reeshabh Kumar Ranjan <reeshabhkumarranjan@gmail.com>
